It was the day after Akane and Inori came to\nstay at Tsubaki Apartments.%K%P
Taking a deep breath of the refreshing morning\nair, I walked along the corridor toward the\nliving room.%K%P
A lot had happened over the last 24 hours, but\nI'd slept like a log and felt much better now.%K%P
This time yesterday I'd never have imagined a\ncouple of goddesses would be moving in with me.%K%P
Whatever the reason, though, I was glad to have\nsome new residents around, like in the old days.%K%P
'Can't let myself get carried away, though...'%K%P
From this day on, the future of Tsubaki was in\nmy hands.%K%P
I'd have to stay focused if I was going to get\nthis right.%K%P
'I'll find a way to save this place, I know it.'%K%P
I gave my cheeks a quick slap to drive away the\nlast of my early-morning daze.%K%P
'Okay, let's do this.'%K%P
Bracing myself, I opened the door to the living\nroom.%K%P
'Good morning.'%K%P
Inori was already there, holding her head in\nfrustration for some reason.%K%P
'Oh... Good morning, Sho.'%K%P
She seemed downhearted.%K%P
'Hey, is something wrong?'%K%P
'I suppose you could say that... Just take a\nlook.'%K%P
I followed Inori's gaze and saw Akane sprawled\non the floor watching TV.%K%P
'Hm? Oh, hi Sho.'%K%P
She dimly registered my presence and gave a\nhalf-hearted wave.%K%P
'Morning, Akane.'%K%P
'Mornin'...'%K%P
Akane replied in a sleepy tone of voice, making\nno move to get up.%K%P
She sounded like she was ready to go back to bed\nat a moment's notice.%K%P
I couldn't sense even the slightest trace of\nvitality from her.%K%P
'Guess you're not a morning person, huh?'%K%P
That explained Inori's exasperation.%K%P
'Rise and shine, Akane. You can't spend all day\ndown there.'%K%P
'Awww, come ooon, it's still early... Five more\nminutes...?'%K%P
'Don't be like that. Today's the day we start\ngetting your life back on track.'%K%P
'Oh yeah... We're really doing that, huh...'%K%P
'We've got plenty of time. No need to dive right\ninto it.'%K%P
Akane was already trying to wriggle out of the\nplan. I can't say I was surprised.%K%P
'Just when are you planning to start applying\nyourself, Akane?'%K%P
'When I feel like it. Could be today, could be\ntomorrow. 'Goddess only knows,' as they say.'%K%P
'Please take this seriously...'%K%P
'Nuh uh. I'm not up for it right now.'%K%P
Akane stuck to the floor and continued to refuse\nto do anything even vaguely responsible.%K%P
This was going to harder than I thought.%K%P
'Get yourself together, Akane! This is\nimportant!'%K%P
'Too bad, I'm busy! I'm gonna spend this whole\nday taking it easy.'%K%P
No matter how hard Inori tried, Akane continued\nto resist any calls to action.%K%P
At this rate, our rehabilitation scheme would be\nover before it even began.%K%P
I tried taking a more firm approach.%K%P
'So, Akane... You're okay with becoming a\nspirit, then?'%K%P
'Hmm, I thought about it, and if that's how\nthings turn out...that's just how it goes,\nright?'%K%P
Even my appeal to her sense of self-preservation\nfell on deaf ears. That was some next-level\nlaziness.%K%P
What was I supposed to do now?%K%P
'Everyone, breakfast is ready!'%K%P
Maika's voice dispersed the gloom that had\nsettled over us.%K%P
'Yay, food! I'm starving! Inori's had me up\nsince the crack of dawn!'%K%P
Akane leaped to her feet and dashed out of the\nroom, her eyes sparkling with glee.%K%P
'Whoa! Hey, Akane!'%K%P
The conversation broke up without us\naccomplishing anything.%K%P
'Good heavens... If Akane's going to be like\nthis, I don't know if rehabilitating her will\neven be possible.'%K%P
'Don't get so down. It's still only the first\nday, and you've got me here to help.'%K%P
Inori looked a little happier when she heard\nthat.%K%P
'Thank you... You're right, it's too early to\ngive up now!'%K%P
'That's the spirit!'%K%P
Inori and I headed for the dining table with\nfresh determination.%K%P
'I'd like to call this meeting to order.'%K%P
Breakfast was over and Maika had gone out on\nsome errand.%K%P
That left me and Inori to discuss possible\nstrategies, while Akane returned to her spot in\nfront of the TV.%K%P
'First and foremost, we've got to find a way to\nmotivate Akane. We won't get anywhere if she\ndoesn't want to cooperate.'%K%P
Right now Akane's attitude was the biggest\nobstacle to her rehabilitation.%K%P
If we could just convince her to be a little\nmore proactive, perhaps the rest would start\nfalling into place.%K%P
'I agree, but just how do we get started?'%K%P
'Let me ask you this, what are we aiming for\nwhen we talk about reforming Akane? How would we\nknow when we were done?'%K%P
Words like 'rehabilitation' weren't a lot of\nhelp for visualizing a specific goal.%K%P
From where I was standing, we had nowhere near\nenough time to get Akane to act more like other\ngoddesses.%K%P
'Hmm... At the very least, she should be able to\nstop her Jinriki from going haywire.'%K%P
'That would mean these blackouts would stop, and\nshe'd be causing much less trouble for the\npeople of this town.'%K%P
'How exactly would we get her to restrain her\npowers?'%K%P
'Akane's powers are rooted in her emotions.'%K%P
'If she can learn to control her feelings\nbetter, that would be a start.'%K%P
Emotional restraint, huh?%K%P
That didn't sound like something we could\nachieve in such a short time.%K%P
There was another issue, too.%K%P
'I'd like to avoid bullying her into it. Is that\nokay?'%K%P
'Naturally. It wouldn't be true rehabilitation\nif we forced it.'%K%P
'I don't want Akane to obey my every\ninstruction, I'd just like her to be more aware\nof her responsibilities.'%K%P
That sounded reasonable to me.%K%P
It wouldn't be right to ignore her feelings on\nthe matter.%K%P
We were left with the question of how to get\nAkane to apply herself while still respecting\nher free-spirited nature.%K%P
'I'm drawing a blank...'%K%P
'Same here...'%K%P
Inori and I discussed things for a little\nlonger, but neither of us could come up with a\nrealistic plan.%K%P
Just as we were reaching the end of our rope,\nAkane suddenly turned up the volume of the show\nshe was watching.%K%P
'Next up, we have a feature on an up-and-coming\nDivine Idol!'%K%P
'A Divine Idol?'%K%P
The screen showed footage of a popular young\nsinger on her nationwide tour.%K%P
'Oh, yeah, I've heard of this girl.'%K%P
Everyone was talking about Divine Idols these\ndays.%K%P
They sang, they danced, they did everything.\nMaika had been telling me about them the other\nday.%K%P
'Idol...? Oh yes, quite a few goddesses seem to\nbe doing that kind of job.'%K%P
The goddess in the video stood on a shining\nstage, clad in a beautiful frilly outfit with a\ncheck design.%K%P
Her performance was breathtaking, packed with\notherworldly effects created by her Jinriki.%K%P
'That looks like so much fun... It's kinda too\nbad I can't do anything like that...%K%P
'Are you a fan, Akane?'%K%P
'I'm just a little curious... I wonder what it's\nlike to have that many followers.'%K%P
I looked back at the TV. The camera had swung\naround to show the concert audience.%K%P
Men and women, young and old, all kinds of\npeople were there, cheering frantically.%K%P
Between songs, they waved and chanted the idol's\nname, all competing for a chance to be noticed.%K%P
Even watching it on the TV like this I could\nfeel all the excitement as if I was really\nthere.%K%P
'Wait a minute...'%K%P
As we watched the concert, an idea started to\ntake form.%K%P
What if we tried to make Akane an idol?%K%P
She obviously liked that kind of thing. Maybe\nthis could be the key to motivating her.%K%P
A local idol would benefit the community, too.\nThat sounded like something Inori's superiors\nwould approve of.%K%P
Plus, it might teach Akane some self control,\nmeaning less blackouts.%K%P
We didn't have any other plans at the moment. I\ncould at least suggest it.%K%P
'Say, Akane?'%K%P
'Hm? Yeah?'%K%P
'If you're interested...why don't you try\nbecoming an idol yourself?'%K%P
'Huh?! Where did that come from?'%K%P
She sounded confused.%K%P
'You said you were curious, right? About having\nthat many followers?'%K%P
'Well, what if you could experience all that\nfirst hand?'%K%P
'For...real?'%K%P
Akane raised an eyebrow.%K%P
I already knew it was useless trying to get her\nto do anything she didn't want to do.%K%P
But maybe we could find something productive\nthat Akane would also enjoy.%K%P
'And that's not all! You could get to wear all\nkinds of cute outfits, and fans would send you\ngifts and stuff.'%K%P
'Outfits...? Gifts...?'%K%P
'I'd help you out, of course. What do you say?\nIt's worth a try, right?'%K%P
Akane's eyes widened in excitement.%K%P
'That sounds great! I bet being an idol is tons\nof fun! And if you're gonna help, it should be a\ncinch! Let's do it!'%K%P
All right, I finally managed to get her\nmotivated about something!%K%P
This was gonna work, I just knew it.%K%P
'Wait just one moment. Akane, an idol? Are you\nserious?'%K%P
Inori brought us back down a notch.%K%P
'She can't sing or dance, and fancy stage\noutfits would be wasted on her, don't you\nthink?'%K%P
'Jeez, what's your problem, Inori?!'%K%P
'I'm simply voicing my opinion.'%K%P
'Next time keep it to yourself!'%K%P
'Whoa, time out! Flying off the handle like that\nisn't going to win you any fans.'%K%P
I did my best to calm Akane down before things\nescalated again.%K%P
'Come on, give me a smile.'%K%P
'We'll take things one step at a time. Let's\nstart by trying to curb your temper. How's that\nsound?'%K%P
'Urrrgh... Okay, I guess. A little at a time,\nthat'll be easy!'%K%P
Akane's anger disappeared and her face broke\ninto a smile.%K%P
I think we dodged a bullet there.%K%P
'Okay, what's next...? I guess you should learn\na little more about human society.'%K%P
'If you're gonna attract fans, you need to be\nable to empathize with them.'%K%P
'You're right... How about you teach me, Sho?'%K%P
'I'll bet I can learn a lot from observing your\nlifestyle!'%K%P
'Sure. I'll do my best to support you from now\non.'%K%P
'I am so psyched! This is gonna be awesome!'%K%P
Akane had thrown off her lethargy and was now\nraring to go.%K%P
'Were you trying to rile her up on purpose...?'%K%P
After Akane dashed out of the room, I confronted\nInori over her objections.%K%P
They had sounded a little staged, somehow.%K%P
'Anyone would get mad at you for saying that\nkind of stuff, not just Akane.'%K%P
'I'm sorry. I just wanted to make it clear that\nshe's going to have to reign in her emotions,\nespecially her anger.'%K%P
Inori was prepared to offend Akane if it meant\nhelping to reform her in the long run. That was\nso like her.%K%P
'You didn't have to set yourself up as the bad\nguy.'%K%P
Her dedication was admirable, but it was going a\nlittle far to try and shoulder all the\nresponsibility herself.%K%P
I wouldn't want to drive a wedge between the two\ngoddesses, even if it was for Akane's sake.%K%P
'I know rehabilitating Akane is important, but\ndon't forget we're in this together.'%K%P
'Heehee, I suppose you're right. I got carried\naway.'%K%P
'Thank you for your concern, Sho.'%K%P
Inori favored me with a bright smile and a\ngraceful bow.%K%P
That settled that.%K%P
'Do you think your boss will go for this plan?'%K%P
'Hm... To be honest, I can never really predict\nhow she'll react to anything.'%K%P
'I'll have to go run it by her first.'%K%P
We had to try. For the time being, that was all\nwe could do.%K%P
'Thanks. I'll leave that part up to you.'%K%P
Our strategy meeting ended with the decision to\ncenter Akane's rehabilitation around an idol\ncareer, pending approval from the higher ups.%K%P
For all we know, they might still shoot down the\nidea.%K%P
My heart pounded while I waited for Inori to get\nback.%K%P
She finally did a few hours later.%K%P
'I'm back.'%K%P
'Hey, Inori. How did it go?'%K%P
'Well... We got the go-ahead.'%K%P
From what she'd said before, I'd thought our\nproposal had a high chance of being rejected. I\nwas surprised it got approved so easily.%K%P
We weren't even given any special conditions to\nwork under.%K%P
It was kind of an anti-climax, but I was glad we\ncould proceed as planned.%K%P
Tomorrow we'd officially start work on Akane's\nrehabilitation.%K%P
'Woohoo! This'll be a blast!'%K%P
